p: The family Herpesviridae is a large family of double-stranded DNA viruses. The species commonly associated with CNS viral-related diseases are CMV, Epstein-Barr virus, HSV-1, HSV-2, HHV-6 and HHV-7 and VZV [ 3]. It must be noted that the test specificity for differentiating between the lymphotropic herpes viruses (Epstein-Barr virus, CMV, HHV-6) and neurotropic viruses (HSV, VZV), varies and is much better for the latter [ 60].
